title.narrative: Diocesan HIV and AIDS Capacity strengthening

description.narrative: This is a 2 years Caritas South Sudan national HIVandAIDS project aimed at strengthening the capacity of church leaders and staff to effectively manage mainstream and integrate HIV/AIDS responses/initiatives. The project will work with religious leaders and laity persons. The programme will ensure among others HIVandAIDS mainstreaming into the church’s pastoral activities as well as actively promoting engagement and participation of various church in the delivery of HIVandAIDS programmes in the communities to increase personal and community risk perceptions in order to reduce and prevent new HIV infections and re-infections, most especially among the most at risk populations (i.e. youths, teenagers, women), in the seven dioceses of South Sudan. The programme targets about 92 church leaders within the various church structures both the clergy and lay people managing various church programmes. CTP will continue with the on-going collaboration and networking with government and other stakeholders to promote the programme within broader development sector and establishing relevant networks, Coordinate with and provide technical support to implementing partner Caritas South Sudan to ensure programme quality and promote learning, innovation and good practices. Support partner advocacy capacity using CTPs voice, facilitate HIV and AIDS mainstreaming , gender related issue and Child protection within CTP and partner activities, support partner to use CAFOD mapping and quality of life tools, conduct joint periodic reviews of the programme, in collaboration with the partners resource financial and technical resources for programme implementation, raise awareness of the programme among other caritas agencies to encourage collaboration and pooling of resources towards the implementation of the programme and report to institutional and other donors funding the programme.
